column4: what is the command to see what devices i have connected in terminal
what kind of devices you talking about?
you could type in mount that will tell you what is mounted
then you could do a dmesg | grep /dev/whatever/your/usb/is/attached/to
that will tell you what it is
i did mount /media/sda1 /mnt/media and .. mount: special device /media/sda1 does not exist
get out of root and use sudo
using root is way too dangerous... even for me :)
Well ok, neither am I, I have been using Linux for about 10 years. Use root at your own risk.
You need to find where the system has attached your usb stick in the /dev directory structure
un plug your usb stick and then wait 30 secs to 1 min and then re plug it
Then dmesg and see where your usb has been attached
